title.narrative: CG Rep. Health Sector Services Development

description.narrative: The development objective of the project is to support the strengthening of the health system in order to effectively combat the major communicable diseases and improve access to quality services for women, children and other vulnerable groups. Within the comprehensive sector development program of the PNDS, the IDA supported project will focus primarily on strengthening sector stewardship, fiduciary systems and monitoring and evaluation (Component1); human resources (Component 2); Infrastructure assessment, mapping and comprehensive rehabilitation plan, including limited construction (Component 3) and, delivery of Package of Essential Services (PSE), with emphasis on Malaria HIV/AIDS and MCH, pharmaceuticals management, community participation/indigenous peoples and equity (Component 4).

condition.narrative: Employ the following experts(a) one human resource expert; (b) two monitoring and evaluation experts; and (c) one public healthexpert;
The Recipient has adopted the Project Implementation Manual.
The Recipient has adopted the new organizational structure for MSASF in accordance with the provisions of Section I (A) 1 ofSchedule 2 to this Agreement;
The Recipient shall record progress of the Project and prepare Project Reports, and shall be furnished to the Association notlaterthan one month after the end of the period covered
established the procurement unit within MSASF, (ii) engaged and trained the procurement staff and (iii) employed the procurementspecialist;
furnish to the Association its Financial Statements audited not later than four months after the end of period
furnish to the Association not later than October 15 in each calendar year, an annual work plan of activities proposed forinclusion in the Project during the following calendar year, with a budget
furnish to the Bank not later than October 15 in each calendar year, the overall proposed budget for the Health Sector Program forthe following calendar year;
introduced in MSASF the financial management system, including (i) adoption of the Financial Management Procedures Manual; (ii)employment of the following financial management staff;
training of MSASF staff in the use of the Financial Management Procedures Manual and accounting software.
